intro: Vasquezia anemonifolia, commonly known as the Anemoneleaf Vasquezia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, preferring well-drained conditions and full sun exposure. Its leaves are palmately divided, resembling those of an anemone, and its yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. Vasquezia anemonifolia is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
